business.headline: Walmart cuts hundreds of roles to streamline operations: ReportEarlier this year, Walmart announced about 1,500 job cuts, which hit teams in its global tech division, online order fulfilment in US stores and its advertising arm, Walmart Connect.
Sensex ends 375 points lower, Nifty below 25,200; Infosys down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 375.24 points to close at 82,259.24, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 100.60 points to end at 25,111.45.
Dalal Street not Asia's darling anymore, says BofA surveyThe latest survey by Bank of America (BofA), shows that investor interest in Indian stock market has dropped in recent months.

How safe are India's instant loan appsFrom students low on fees to families with sudden hospital bills, many use instant loan apps for fast cash, some promise money in 10–30 minutes using just a phone and a few documents.

Sebi looks to extend tenure of derivatives contracts, says officialSebi is signalling a shift toward deeper, more stable markets by discouraging speculative short-term trades and pushing for longer-tenure contracts, amid growing retail losses and extreme derivatives dominance.

Is Thane outshining Mumbai real estate with cheaper housing?Most new homes coming up in Thane are either 1BHK or 2BHK units. About 45% of new supply from 2020 to 2025 was 2BHKs, while 42% was 1BHKs. Larger homes like 3BHKs and 4BHKs together make up only around 13% of the new supply.

Personal loan rates 2025: How much are SBI, ICICI and others charging?Many banks in India have updated their personal loan interest rates for 2025. Most banks are offering rates starting from about 9.50% per year and going up to 10.50% for some customers, depending on their credit score and repayment ability.

TCS benching policy sparks fear among employees after first cycle: ReportThe policy, introduced on June 12, limits the time employees can remain without project work to just 35 days. After this, they face the risk of losing out on promotions or even losing their jobs.

New UPI rules: What happens if payments fail now?Earlier, if someone raised a chargeback, say, when money was deducted, but they did not get what they paid for, and it got declined, the bank had to go through an extra step.

Parliament panel proposes revival of key tax relief for companies: ReportThe government is set to restore Section 80M in the new Income Tax Bill, easing dividend tax burdens for companies. The bill is likely to pass in the Monsoon Session.

Are e-commerce firms hiding your rating? New survey reveals the truthThe survey asked consumers about their experience when posting negative reviews on e-commerce and quick commerce apps. Out of 16,519 responses, only 11% said their negative reviews were "published as is."
Sensex opens flat, Nifty above 25,200; SBI shares up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 41.02 points to 82,593.46, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 13.30 points to 25,198.75 as of 9:30 am.

entertainment.headline: The Po Po Song: Ajay Devgn, Guru Randhawa bring back nostalgia in Son of Sardaar 2The makers of the much-awaited film 'Son of Sardaar 2' released 'The Po Po Song' on Thursday. For the song, actor Ajay Devgn collaborated with singer Guru Randhawa for the first time.

Top films and shows to watch on Prime Video this weekendA host of new films and shows will be available for streaming this weekend on Prime Video. These include Dhanush's 'Kuberaa', season 3 of Lola Tung's 'The Summer I Turned Pretty' and Judy Sheindlin's 'Justice on Trial'.

German film Brick might be the most thrilling thing to watch on OTT this weekendThe German thriller 'Brick' is trending at number 2 on Netflix's list of top movies in India. The film features actors Matthias Schweighofer and Ruby O. Fee in the lead roles. It is psychological and dystopian, but is it worth a watch? Let's find out.

The Summer I Turned Pretty? More like the summer my best friend backstabbed meWhen your best friend starts acting more like a life coach and less like a friend, it's time to take a step back. Here's how 'The Summer I Turned Pretty' is showing us signs that your friend might not always know what's best for you.

Ibrahim Ali Khan offers a glimpse into his intense training for SarzameenIbrahim Ali Khan will be seen in an intense role in 'Sarzameen', where he plays the son of Prithviraj and Kajol who turns into a terrorist. Before the film's release on July 25 on JioHotstar, he shared behind-the-scenes photos and training glimpses.

Pretty Little Baby singer Connie Francis dies at 87Legendary 1960s pop singer Connie Francis, known for hits like the viral 'Pretty Little Baby', died at the age of 87. She was the first solo female artiste to top the Billboard Hot 100.

Janaki V vs State of Kerala review: Noble intentions marred by flawed executionRelease Date:Thu Jul 17, 2025Janaki V vs State of Kerala movie review: Written and directed by Pravin Narayanan, the Malayalam suspense drama film stars Suresh Gopi and Anupama Parameshwaran in the lead.

Karan Kundrra shuts down wedding rumours with Tejasswi Prakash, says not married yetActor Karan Kundrra clarified that he and Tejasswi Prakash are not married yet, dismissing ongoing rumours. He expressed his love for rituals and shared how Tejasswi has influenced his spiritual side.

Saiyaara actor Aneet Padda pays poetic tribute to Mohit Suri's musical vision'Saiyaara' actor Aneet Padda shared a heartfelt note dedicated to director Mohit Suri. She highlighted his unique vision and emotional depth in music and storytelling.

Prabhas, Rana's cheeky banter on 'Why Kattappa killed Baahubali' wins the internet'Baahubali' is all set for a grand re-release this October, rekindling the iconic question about Katappa's betrayal with hilarious replies from stars Prabhas and Rana Daggubati. The friendly banter received fans' appreciation on social media.

Special Ops 2 OTT release: Kay Kay Menon returns to battle cyber terrorismThe much-anticipated 'Special Ops 2', featuring Kay Kay Menon, highlights cyber warfare dangers. Premiering on July 18, it introduces Tahir Raj Bhasin as a new antagonist, focusing on digital terrorism.

AP Dhillon and Tara Sutaria's chemistry is star of Thodi Si Daaru songThe much-awaited Punjabi song 'Thodi Si Daaru' featuring singer AP Dhillon and actor Tara Sutaria has been released. The song also marks Dhillon's first collaboration with Shreya Ghoshal.

Joe Wright's Pride & Prejudice to re-release in theatres - all you need to knowJoe Wright's 'Pride & Prejudice' (2005), starring Keira Knightley and Matthew MacFadyen, returns to Indian theatres on July 25. Re-released by PVR INOX and UIP, the beloved adaptation offers fans a chance to relive Jane Austen's timeless romance on the big screen.

The Map That Leads To You trailer: Madelyn Cline, KJ Apa chase magic in EuropePrime Video is all set to release the romantic drama 'The Map That Leads To You' on August 20, featuring a heartfelt love story against the enchanting backdrop of Europe. Directed by Lasse Hallstrom, the film beautifully captures a journey of self-discovery and unexpected connections.

The ABC of stunts in Bollywood, Akshay Kumar's insurance and how it still is riskyBollywood has significantly improved stunt safety standards, highlighted by Akshay Kumar's initiative to provide health and accident insurance for hundreds of stunt professionals. Despite the inherent risks in stunt work, these measures offer vital protection and financial support to artistes in the Hindi film industry.

Hoppers trailer: A young scientist turns beaver in Avatar-inspired jungle adventureThe trailer of 'Hoppers' teases an 'Avatar'-esque jungle sci-fi, adventure-comedy. In the upcoming animation film, a young scientist hops into the body of a lifelike robotic beaver.

Saare Jahan Se Accha: Pratik Gandhi leads India's secret mission in espionage-dramaPratik Gandhi's upcoming series 'Saare Jahan Se Accha' is an espionage drama set in the 1970s. The show highlights the challenges faced by intelligence officers while protecting the nation from hidden threats.

Saiyaara advance booking: Ahaan Pandey could just be the new overnight sensationYRF's 'Saiyaara' is on its way to emerging as the biggest launchpad for any Bollywood debutant in a long time. Ahaan Pandey and Aneet Padda could just find their big claim to fame if the numbers are to be believed at the box office.

Ronit Roy breaks silence on rumours of replacing Sudhanshu Pandey in AnupamaaActor Ronit Roy refuted claims of joining 'Anupamaa' as Vanraj Shah. Roy said the rumours are not true. The role was earlier played by actor Sudhanshu Pandey, who quit the show in 2024.

general news.headline: Foreign nationals in voter list? Inside Bihar's suspicious revision driveThey came with Aadhaar, ration cards, and years of life in India. But in Bihar's border districts, silence now greets their names on voter forms.

Criminals' morale sky-high: Chirag Paswan slams ally on Patna hospital shootingHours after a murder convict out on parole for medical treatment was shot dead by rival gangsters at a hospital in Patna, Union Minister Chirag Paswan slammed his ally JD(U)-led Bihar government, questioning it over rising crime in the state.

What is the Dharmasthala mass-burial case and the horror stories of skeletonsAllegations of the bodies of hundreds of women who were raped and murdered over years being buried in the popular pilgrimage town of Dharmasthala in Karnataka have shocked people. A former sanitation worker on the payroll of the temple administration from 1995 to 2014 claims he buried and burned the bodies of victims under coercion from immensely influential people. He has now dug up some of the skeletons.

AI 171 fuel switch-off mystery: All expert theories we have heard so farExperts are debating how Air India Flight 171's fuel control switch turned to CUT OFF mid-air, with theories pointing to human error, technical malfunction, or design flaw. The final cause remains uncertain as investigations continue.

Janaki V vs State of Kerala review: Noble intentions marred by flawed executionRelease Date:Thu Jul 17, 2025Janaki V vs State of Kerala movie review: Written and directed by Pravin Narayanan, the Malayalam suspense drama film stars Suresh Gopi and Anupama Parameshwaran in the lead.

Supreme Court raps Karnataka High Court for bail to actor Darshan in murder caseThe Supreme Court has cast doubt on the Karnataka High Court's decision to grant bail to actor Darshan in the Renukaswamy murder case, citing questionable use of judicial discretion.

How Animesh Kujur trained to be India's fastest sprinterThe 22-year-old Chhattisgarh tribal youth, with extensive physical training and sports exposure in school days, used the Covid years to train with army aspirants

Sensitive matter, in touch with friendly governments: India on Nimisha Priya caseThe Indian government said it provided regular consular visits to the family of Nimisha Priya, a nurse from Kerala on death row in Yemen, and was in contact with friendly governments over the "sensitive matter".

Caught on CCTV: BMW hits scooter in Gujarat, man thrown in air, dies on spotThe entire sequence of events was captured on nearby CCTV cameras. The footage clearly shows the moment the black BMW collided with the scooter at the intersection. According to eyewitnesses, the car, driven by a man reportedly under the influence of alcohol, struck the scooter at an intersection on Thursday morning.
SSVM Institutions: From Cradle to CosmosForging Futures with Foresight, Flair, and Faith

Supari killings due to no farm work: Bihar cop links April-June murders to monsoonBihar Additional General of Police Kundan Krishnan's remark linking pre-monsoon murders to lack of farm work has sparked political outrage, with both opposition and ruling leaders slamming the statement.

How a 1977 Punjab poll made poll body's absolute powers open to judicial reviewOn March 21, 1977, the counting at the constituency headquarters was aborted at the final hour as the postal ballots were being counted due to mob violence allegedly mobilised at the instance of one of the main candidates from the constituency.

Your beauty essentials are the most trending accessories nowIn 2025, beauty is no longer tucked away in makeup pouches - it's worn proudly on waist chains, handbags and phone covers, turning everyday essentials like lip balm and sunscreen into statement accessories.

Pretty Little Baby singer Connie Francis dies at 87Legendary 1960s pop singer Connie Francis, known for hits like the viral 'Pretty Little Baby', died at the age of 87. She was the first solo female artiste to top the Billboard Hot 100.

1,563 Indians deported from US since Trump took office on January 20: GovernmentData shared by the MEA in Parliament earlier showed that the US had previously deported 6,135 Indians during Trump's first tenure from 2017 to 2021.

RSS hint on Modi's retirement BJP's golden chance to name Dalit PM: SiddaramaiahCiting RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's comment hinting at Prime Minister Narendra Modi's political exit, Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah challenged BJP to name a Dalit as its next Prime Ministerial candidate.

Is this video of an Indian family's birthday celebration even real?The video features an Indian family gathered around a table as a child's birthday cake is placed on the table by her mother. Her friends cheered and clapped.

Palaniswamy says AIADMK will lead alliance, dares Stalin allies to switch sidesEdappadi K Palaniswami rules out coalition confusion, affirms AIADMK will lead the alliance and form the government in Tamil Nadu. He invites 'disillusioned' DMK allies to switch sides before polls.

Karnataka clears filing criminal cases against RCB, state cricket body over stampedeThe Karnataka Cabinet has approved filing of criminal cases against Royal Challengers Bengaluru and Karnataka State Cricket Association for gross negligence, based on the Justice Michael D'Cunha Commission's findings.
Better sex could be a G-Shot or O-Shot awayWhy India is witnessing a rising preference for these minimally invasive interventions to women's sexual wellness

The Shubhanshu Shukla Effect: What pilot jobs look like in 2025 and beyondOnce seen only as flyers, today's pilots are stepping into roles in space tech, drone robotics, aviation law, and more. Inspired by IAF pilot Shubhanshu Shukla, experts explain how Gen Z can build diverse aviation careers -- on the ground and in the skies -- with the right skills, training, and vision.

You find foreigners in Bihar poll list but not killers in Pahalgam: Owaisi to PMAsaduddin Owaisi said that Operation Sindoor should not be stopped until the terrorists involved in the Pahalgam attack are found. He further warned that he would continue to ask tough questions of the government until all four terrorists are located.

Volodymyr Zelenskyy appoints Yuliia Svyrydenko as new Prime Minister of UkraineAt home, however, the Cabinet recalibration has not been seen as a major shift, as the Ukrainian leader continues to rely on officials who have proven their effectiveness and loyalty during the war, now in its fourth year.

In rare move, Supreme Court reverses own order, grants boy's custody to motherIn its previous order, the Supreme Court had upheld the Kerala High Court judgment granting permanent custody of the child to his father.

sports.headline: Yashasvi Jaiswal's poor shot opened up the Lord's Test: Stuart BroadFormer England fast bowler Stuart Broad feels India opener Yashasvi Jaiswal's poor shot on Day 4 of the third Test at Lord's opened up the game which eventually led to India's loss.

Won't be easy: Litton Das eyes Pakistan heist after Sri Lanka T20I winBAN vs PAK: Litton Das said Bangladesh will need to work hard in their upcoming T20I series against Pakistan. His comments came after leading the Tigers to their maiden T20I series victory over Sri Lanka on Wednesday.

Shimron Hetmyer goes berserk, blasts 5 Sixes in an over in Global Super LeagueGuyana Amazon Warriors batter Shimron Hetmyer hit five sixes in an over against Guyana Amazon Warriors' Fabian Allen in the Global Super League.

Bangladesh name squad for home T20Is against PakistanBAN vs PAK: After their series win against Sri Lanka, Litton Das' Bangladesh are set to lock horns with Pakistan, starting July 20 at the Sher-e-Bangla National Stadium in Mirpur.

Indian Super League: Chennaiyin FC, Owen Coyle part ways by mutual consentChennaiyin FC announced that they have decided to mutually part ways with Owen Coyle, who came into the club for his second stint.

Ravi Shastri warns England after Lord's Test win: It may hurt like AustraliaFormer India cricketer and head coach Ravi Shastri has warned England of facing Australia's fate after the WTC points deduction following their 22-run win at Lord's.

Deep Dasgupta wants Sai Sudarshan over Karun Nair after Lord's failureIndia vs England: Former India wicketkeeper Deep Dasgupta believes it's time to look beyond Karun Nair after his failure in 3 Tests against England. Dasgupta wants to back promising youngster Sai Sudharsan, who was discarded after the opening Test match at Leeds.

Rashford doesn't deserve move to Barcelona: Sheringham slams United starFormer Manchester United striker, Teddy Sheringham hopes that Marcus Rashford does get the move to FC Barcelona. The club legend believes that the striker has not deserved such a move after reflecting on his time with Manchester United.

Lakshya Sen focusing on achieving peak fitness after Japan Open exitLakshya Sen suffered an early exit at the Japan Open. The ace shuttler now aims to get back to full fitness before the world championships in Paris.

Deepti Sharma credits Rishabh Pant for new one-handed shot in her armouryIndia all-rounder Deepti Sharma has credited Rishabh Pant for the new one-handed shot in her armoury, which she played during her match-winning innings in the first ODI against England in Southampton.

Deepti not looking too far ahead of World Cup: Going one match at a timeDeepti Sharma is just taking it one game at a time. She does not want to get too ahead of herself and overwhelm her with the pressure of playing in the ODI World Cup. Instead she intends to take it a game at a time and focus on contributing each time.

Alastair Cook taunts bowlers over persistent ball change requestsFormer England captain Alastair Cook has added his voice—and a dose of humour—to the growing debate around the Dukes ball in the ongoing five-match Test series between England and India.

Japan Open 2025: Lakshya Sen, Satwik-Chirag eliminated in Round of 16 clashIndia's charge in the Japan Open is all but over as top stars like Lakshya Sen and the men's doubles pair of Satwiksairaj Rankireddy-Chirag Shetty were eliminated from the tournament after losing their respective Round of 16 matches.

Gautam Gambhir will have to alter India's Jasprit Bumrah plan: David LloydFormer England cricketer David Lloyd feels India head coach Gautam Gambhir will have to alter their plans regarding Jasprit Bumrah to make a comeback in the ongoing series against England.

KL Rahul will outscore Shubman Gill in coming matches: Former England batterFormer England batter Owais Shah has backed KL Rahul to outscore Shubman Gill in the coming matches. Both Rahul and Gill have been in marvellous form in the ongoing series, having plundered runs in the first three matches.

Clive Lloyd urges complete overhaul of West Indies cricket after historic collapseClive Lloyd, the legendary former West Indies captain, has called for a serious and thorough review of cricket at all levels in the Caribbean. His remarks come in the wake of the West Indies Test team's shocking collapse against Australia, where they were dismissed for just 27 runs at Sabina Park.

Praggnanandhaa stuns Magnus Carlsen with 39 moves in Freestyle Chess tournamentTeenage Indian Grandmaster Rameshbabu Praggnanandhaa continued his strong form in 2025 with a statement victory over world number one Magnus Carlsen at the Freestyle Chess Grand Slam in Las Vegas.

Brian Lara slams West Indies Cricket Board for Nicholas Pooran's early retirementLegendary batter Brian Lara has slammed the West Indies Cricket Board for the retirement of Nicholas Pooran, blaming them for not doing anything to keep players loyal.

Jude Bellingham undergoes surgery on dislocated shoulder injuryReal Madrid midfielder Jude Bellingham has successfully undergone surgery to correct a long-standing shoulder dislocation issue, the Spanish club announced on Wednesday.

Lamine Yamal inherits Lionel Messi's iconic Barcelona number 10 jerseyYoung Barcelona star Lamine Yamal inherited the club's iconic number 10 shirt-previously worn by all-time great Lionel Messi-on Wednesday. "Our 10," wrote Barça on social media, alongside a video featuring the teenager.

Meet Animesh Kujur: India's fastest man, breaking one barrier at a timeAt just 22, Animesh Kujur is now India's fastest man yet. Hailing from a remote village in Chhattisgarh, he is rewriting the history of Indian track and field.

Shubman Gill's Kohli-style aggression triggered England's beast mode: MoeenFormer England all-rounder Moeen Ali believes Shubman Gill's on-field aggression during the Lord's Test was reminiscent of Virat Kohli's intensity - and may have inadvertently brought out the most competitive side of England in the ongoing series.

Deepti Sharma helps India complete mammoth run chase vs EnglandDeepti Sharma gave India the upper hand against England once again—this time in more conventional fashion—with a match-winning half-century in Southampton that secured a 1-0 lead in the three-match ODI series.

Russell to retire from international cricket after 1st two T20Is vs AustraliaWest Indies all-rounder Andre Russell is all set to retire from international cricket after the first two T20Is against Australia. The first two matches of the series will take place on July 20 and 22.

Embarrassing running: Harleen Deol faces flak for bizarre run outENG-W vs IND-W: Harleen Deol fell to a direct hit from Alice Davidson-Richards in the first ODI in Southampton, after which the Indian batter was greeted with criticism.

No long-term goals, just stay injury-free ahead of World Championships: SatwiksairajSatwiksairaj Rankireddy said that he and Chirag Shetty aren't keeping any long-term goals in mind and are focused on remaining fit for next month's World Championships.

Bangladesh secure historic T20I series win vs Sri Lanka after Tanzid, Mahedi fireSL vs BAN: Litton Das' Bangladesh claimed the T20I series 2-1 after winning the decider against Sri Lanka on Wednesday by eight wickets at the R. Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
